column4: because the command has rc in it, and if you ran it, you'll find it that way
i get a weird message about runlevel 1
did you get my message?
yes, systems wont boot now, no x
no X may make sense.  not booting does not.
I think perhaps you don't really mean it's not booting.
it is probably booting and then giving you an error message and dumping you in a shell, which is entirely different
I can't help you if you can't be accurate.
sure
or just edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf, and change nvidia to nv
it doesn't hang there.  hang means the machine is dead, the caps lock key doesn't work, control-alt-f1 doesn't show a console, etc.
it does nothing at the hardware detection area, and i cannot get it out of that area. is the a way to verbrose the boot provess to see wahts going on
no, but you can reboot in recovery mode, and look at the log file in /var/log
it will tell you what happened.  it will be /var/log/X.......     the only one starting with X
whichever is easier
let's back up and think for a moment.  We know the following things:
one, you installed the nvidia drivers with no problems in breezy
you followed the instructions for doing it in dapper and it isn't working for you
therefore, none of the things you are thinking, looking at, etc., make the slightest bit of sense, because if they did, breezy wouldn't work either.
what you should do is simply run breezy.  Why do you need to upgrade, _right now_, to dapper?
wait until dapper gets all sorted out, and then use it.
have you tried the apache irc channels?
